member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream.
member.param: Represents the type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
The destination stream to write to.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel.Deserialize(System.Int32,System.Object,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance (which may be null).
member.param: Represents the type (including inheritance) to consider.
The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel.CompileInPlace

member.remarks: A full compilation is restricted to accessing public types / members

The path for the new dll
member.returns: An instance of the newly created compiled type-model

member.remarks: A full compilation is restricted to accessing public types / members
member.returns: An instance of the newly created compiled type-model

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel.MetadataTimeoutMilliseconds
member.summary: The amount of time to wait if there are concurrent metadata access operations

member.name: E:ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel.LockContended
member.summary: If a lock-contention is detected, this event signals the *owner* of the lock responsible for the blockage, indicating what caused the problem; this is only raised if the lock-owning code successfully completes.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel.SetDefaultFactory(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Designate a factory-method to use to create instances of any type; note that this only affect types seen by the serializer *after* setting the factory.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.LockContentedEventArgs.OwnerStackTrace
member.summary: The stack-trace of the code that owned the lock when a lock-contention scenario occurred

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.LockContentedEventHandler
member.summary: Event-type that is raised when a lock-contention scenario is detected

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments needed to perform type-formatting functions; this could be resolving a Type to a string suitable for serialization, or could be requesting a Type from a string. If no changes are made, a default implementation will be used (from the assembly-qualified names).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.Type
member.summary: The type involved in this map; if this is initially null, a Type is expected to be provided for the string in FormattedName.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventArgs.FormattedName
member.summary: The formatted-name involved in this map; if this is initially null, a formatted-name is expected from the type in Type.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeFormatEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate type used to perform type-formatting functions; the sender originates as the type-model.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DeserializeItems(System.IO.Stream,System.Type,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.Serializer.TypeResolver)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
On a field-by-field basis, the type of object to deserialize (can be null if "type" is specified).
The type of object to deserialize (can be null if "resolver" is specified).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
On a field-by-field basis, the type of object to deserialize (can be null if "type" is specified).
The type of object to deserialize (can be null if "resolver" is specified).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.
member.param: Additional information about this serialization operation.

member.summary: Returns true if the type supplied is either a recognised contract type, or a *list* of a recognised contract type.

member.name: E:ProtoBuf.Meta.TypeModel.DynamicTypeFormatting

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember
member.summary: Represents a member (property/field) that is mapped to a protobuf field

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.FieldNumber
member.summary: The number that identifies this member in a protobuf stream

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.Member
member.summary: Gets the member (field/property) which this member relates to.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.ItemType
member.summary: Within a list / array / etc, the type of object for each item in the list (especially useful with ArrayList)

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.MemberType
member.summary: The underlying type of the member

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.DefaultType
member.summary: For abstract types (IList etc), the type of concrete object to create (if required)

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.ParentType
member.summary: The type the defines the member

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value of the item (members with this value will not be serialized)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.#ctor(ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel,System.Type,System.Int32,System.Reflection.MemberInfo,System.Type,System.Type,System.Type,ProtoBuf.DataFormat,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a new ValueMember instance

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.#ctor(ProtoBuf.Meta.RuntimeTypeModel,System.Int32,System.Type,System.Type,System.Type,ProtoBuf.DataFormat)
member.summary: Creates a new ValueMember instance

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.DataFormat
member.summary: Specifies the rules used to process the field; this is used to determine the most appropriate wite-type, but also to describe subtypes within that wire-type (such as SignedVariant)

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsStrict
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should follow strict encoding rules; this means (for example) that if a "fixed32" is encountered when "variant" is defined, then it will fail (throw an exception) when parsing. Note that when serializing the defined type is always used.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsPacked
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should use packed encoding (which can save lots of space for repeated primitive values). This option only applies to list/array data of primitive types (int, double, etc).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.OverwriteList
member.summary: Indicates whether this field should *repace* existing values (the default is false, meaning *append*). This option only applies to list/array data.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.IsRequired
member.summary: Indicates whether this field is mandatory.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.AsReference
member.summary: Enables full object-tracking/full-graph support.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.DynamicType
member.summary: Embeds the type information into the stream, allowing usage with types not known in advance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.SetSpecified(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Specifies methods for working with optional data members.
member.param: Provides a method (null for none) to query whether this member should be serialized; it must be of the form "bool {Method}()". The member is only serialized if the method returns true.
Provides a method (null for none) to indicate that a member was deserialized; it must be of the form "void {Method}(bool)", and will be called with "true" when data is found.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.Name
member.summary: Gets the logical name for this member in the schema (this is not critical for binary serialization, but may be used when inferring a schema).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Meta.ValueMember.SupportNull
member.summary: Should lists have extended support for null values? Note this makes the serialization less efficient.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle
member.summary: Specifies the type of prefix that should be applied to messages.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.None
member.summary: No length prefix is applied to the data; the data is terminated only be the end of the stream.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Base128
member.summary: A base-128 length prefix is applied to the data (efficient for short messages).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Fixed32
member.summary: A fixed-length (little-endian) length prefix is applied to the data (useful for compatibility).

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle.Fixed32BigEndian
member.summary: A fixed-length (big-endian) length prefix is applied to the data (useful for compatibility).

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a type is defined for protocol-buffer serialization.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined name of the type.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFirstTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the fist offset to use with implicit field tags; only uesd if ImplicitFields is set.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.UseProtoMembersOnly
member.summary: If specified, alternative contract markers (such as markers for XmlSerailizer or DataContractSerializer) are ignored.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.IgnoreListHandling
member.summary: If specified, do NOT treat this type as a list, even if it looks like one.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.ImplicitFields
member.summary: Gets or sets the mechanism used to automatically infer field tags for members. This option should be used in advanced scenarios only. Please review the important notes against the ImplicitFields enumeration.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromName
member.summary: Enables/disables automatic tag generation based on the existing name / order of the defined members. This option is not used for members marked with ProtoMemberAttribute, as intended to provide compatibility with WCF serialization. WARNING: when adding new fields you must take care to increase the Order for new elements, otherwise data corruption may occur.
member.remarks: If not explicitly specified, the default is assumed from Serializer.GlobalOptions.InferTagFromName.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.InferTagFromNameHasValue
member.summary: Has a InferTagFromName value been explicitly set? if not, the default from the type-model is assumed.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.DataMemberOffset
member.summary:
Specifies an offset to apply to [DataMember(Order=...)] markers; this is useful when working with mex-generated classes that have a different origin (usually 1 vs 0) than the original data-contract.
This value is added to the Order of each member.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.SkipConstructor
member.summary: If true, the constructor for the type is bypassed during deserialization, meaning any field initializers or other initialization code is skipped.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoContractAttribute.AsReferenceDefault
member.summary: Should this type be treated as a reference by default? Please also see the implications of this, as recorded on ProtoMemberAttribute.AsReference

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute
member.summary: Used to define protocol-buffer specific behavior for enumerated values.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific value to use for this enum during serialization.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.HasValue
member.summary: Indicates whether this instance has a customised value mapping
member.returns: true if a specific value is set

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoEnumAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the defined name of the enum, as used in .proto (this name is not used during serialization).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.InternStrings
member.summary: Gets / sets a flag indicating whether strings should be checked for repetition; if true, any repeated UTF-8 byte sequence will result in the same String instance, rather than a second instance of the same string. Enabled by default. Note that this uses a custom interner - the system-wide string interner is not used.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources used by the reader, but importantly does not Dispose the underlying stream; in many typical use-cases the stream is used for different processes, so it is assumed that the consumer will Dispose their stream separately.

member.summary: Reads a signed 32-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.summary: Reads a signed 64-bit integer from the stream; supported wire-types: Variant, Fixed32, Fixed64, SignedVariant

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadObject(System.Object,System.Int32,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Reads (merges) a sub-message from the stream, internally calling StartSubItem and EndSubItem, and (in between) parsing the message in accordance with the model associated with the reader

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.EndSubItem(ProtoBuf.SubItemToken,ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Makes the end of consuming a nested message in the stream; the stream must be either at the correct EndGroup marker, or all fields of the sub-message must have been consumed (in either case, this means ReadFieldHeader should return zero)

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.StartSubItem(ProtoBuf.ProtoReader)
member.summary: Begins consuming a nested message in the stream; supported wire-types: StartGroup, String
member.remarks: The token returned must be help and used when callining EndSubItem

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.ReadFieldHeader
member.summary: Reads a field header from the stream, setting the wire-type and retuning the field number. If no more fields are available, then 0 is returned. This methods respects sub-messages.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.TryReadFieldHeader(System.Int32)
member.summary: Looks ahead to see whether the next field in the stream is what we expect (typically; what we've just finished reading - for example ot read successive list items)

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Model
member.summary: Get the TypeModel associated with this reader

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Hint(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Compares the streams current wire-type to the hinted wire-type, updating the reader if necessary; for example, a Variant may be updated to SignedVariant. If the hinted wire-type is unrelated then no change is made.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.ProtoReader.Assert(ProtoBuf.WireType)
member.summary: Verifies that the stream's current wire-type is as expected, or a specialized sub-type (for example, SignedVariant) - in which case the current wire-type is updated. Otherwise an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Serializer
member.summary: Provides protocol-buffer serialization capability for concrete, attributed types. This is a *default* model, but custom serializer models are also supported.
member.remarks: Protocol-buffer serialization is a compact binary format, designed to take advantage of sparse data and knowledge of specific data types; it is also extensible, allowing a type to be deserialized / merged even if some data is not recognised.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.GetProto``1

member.typeparam: The type to generate a .proto definition for
member.returns: The .proto definition as a string

member.summary: Create a deep clone of the supplied instance; any sub-items are also cloned.

member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance.
member.typeparam: The type being merged.
member.param: The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.Deserialize``1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream
member.typeparam: The type to be created.
member.param: The binary stream to apply to the new instance (cannot be null).
member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

The destination stream to write to.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.ChangeType``2(``0)
member.summary: Serializes a given instance and deserializes it as a different type; this can be used to translate between wire-compatible objects (where two .NET types represent the same data), or to promote/demote a type through an inheritance hierarchy.
member.remarks: No assumption of compatibility is made between the types.
member.typeparam: The type of the object being copied.
The type of the new object to be created.
member.param: The existing instance to use as a template.
member.returns: A new instane of type TNewType, with the data from TOldType.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.DeserializeItems``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of consecutive length-prefixed items from a stream, using either base-128 or fixed-length prefixes. Base-128 prefixes with a tag are directly comparable to serializing multiple items in succession (use the tag to emulate the implicit behavior when serializing a list/array). When a tag is specified, any records with different tags are silently omitted. The tag is ignored. The tag is ignores for fixed-length prefixes.
member.typeparam: The type of object to deserialize.
member.param: The binary stream containing the serialized records.
The prefix style used in the data.
The tag of records to return (if non-positive, then no tag is expected and all records are returned).
member.returns: The sequence of deserialized objects.

member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream that has a length-prefix on data (to assist with network IO).
member.typeparam: The type to be created.
member.param: The binary stream to apply to the new instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.DeserializeWithLengthPrefix``1(System.IO.Stream,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new instance from a protocol-buffer stream that has a length-prefix on data (to assist with network IO).
member.typeparam: The type to be created.
member.param: The binary stream to apply to the new instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The expected tag of the item (only used with base-128 prefix style).
member.returns: A new, initialized instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.MergeWithLengthPrefix``1(System.IO.Stream,``0,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle)
member.summary: Applies a protocol-buffer stream to an existing instance, using length-prefixed data - useful with network IO.
member.typeparam: The type being merged.
member.param: The existing instance to be modified (can be null).
The binary stream to apply to the instance (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
member.returns: The updated instance; this may be different to the instance argument if either the original instance was null, or the stream defines a known sub-type of the original instance.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.SerializeWithLengthPrefix``1(System.IO.Stream,``0,ProtoBuf.PrefixStyle)
member.summary: Writes a protocol-buffer representation of the given instance to the supplied stream, with a length-prefix. This is useful for socket programming, as DeserializeWithLengthPrefix/MergeWithLengthPrefix can be used to read the single object back from an ongoing stream.
member.typeparam: The type being serialized.
member.param: The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.
The destination stream to write to.

member.param: The existing instance to be serialized (cannot be null).
How to encode the length prefix.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializer.FlushPool
member.summary: Releases any internal buffers that have been reserved for efficiency; this does not affect any serialization operations; simply: it can be used (optionally) to release the buffers for garbage collection (at the expense of having to re-allocate a new buffer for the next operation, rather than re-use prior buffers).

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Serializers.IProtoSerializer.RequiresOldValue
member.summary: Indicates whether a Read operation replaces the existing value, or extends the value. If false, the "value" parameter to Read is discarded, and should be passed in as null.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Serializers.IProtoSerializer.ReturnsValue
member.summary: Now all Read operations return a value (although most do); if false no value should be expected.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializers.IProtoSerializer.EmitWrite(ProtoBuf.Compiler.CompilerContext,ProtoBuf.Compiler.Local)
member.summary: Emit the IL necessary to perform the given actions to serialize this data.
member.param: Details and utilities for the method being generated.

The source of the data to work against; If the value is only needed once, then LoadValue is sufficient. If the value is needed multiple times, then note that a "null" means "the top of the stack", in which case you should create your own copy - GetLocalWithValue.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Serializers.IProtoSerializer.EmitRead(ProtoBuf.Compiler.CompilerContext,ProtoBuf.Compiler.Local)
member.summary: Emit the IL necessary to perform the given actions to deserialize this data.
member.param: Details and utilities for the method being generated.

For nested values, the instance holding the values; note that this is not always provided - a null means not supplied. Since this is always a variable or argument, it is not necessary to consume this value.
